name: tasktimer
about: This excercise application is quite advanced Pomodoro Clock built with React, featuring a playful, interactive board game-like interface. It supports concurrent multi-tasking, allowing multiple tasks to run simultaneously.

features.label: Functionality
items: simplistic client-side user authentication
user's profile edition
creating, editing and removing tasks by specifying a task name, time and maximum break time
validation rules applied to inputs
progress bars for both elapsed and remaining time modes
stats section for all finished tasks
local storage support for saving the data

features.label: User Interface
items: intro animation is based on SVG logo with masking applied to casted shadow
minimizable cards
drag and drop functionality without third-party libraries
app is fully responsive with grid of cards adjusting to viewport size
implemented based on the Figma mockup

name: hydrapp
about: This playful app is a water consumption tracker that allows users to easily log their daily water intake. It features an archive section for viewing weekly consumption trends and an account settings section for personalization. Users can view their own and others' statistics. The app incorporates gamification elements, rewarding users with points for maintaining consistent water intake, and features a dynamic user ranking system.

features.label: Functionality
items: archive section for viewing weekly consumption trends
stats section displaying each user's daily water intake
calculating user's current and longest streak
ranking of users based on highest point score
profile settings edition
local storage support for saving the data

features.label: Animations
items: intro animation
animated water level and counter
emojis indicating consumed amount of water

name: portfolio
about: This project is a showcase of my top five frontend projects, including this one, each presented in its own section. Additional sections feature simpler, early-stage projects. The site is a Single Page Application (SPA) with a focus on interactivity and animation, balanced with performance considerations to ensure smooth transitions.

Each section features a unique color palette, resulting in a total of 68 different colors across the site, managed effectively using SCSS. The project was initially built with vanilla JavaScript and later rewritten using React.

features.label: Functionality
items: async/await code for executing intro animations in a sequence
using github API to fetch project details data
custom accordions without use of third-party libraries
extensive use of SVG elements - logos, graphics, menu items
different menu components for mobile and desktop devices

name: archviz
about: This project balances the use of high-quality images with page load performance by implementing SVG placeholders for each image. Raster images are loaded progressively based on their visibility on the screen, utilizing lazy loading. The project is built primarily with custom functions, with few exceptions. All visualizations on the site were created by me when I used to work as an architectural visualizer.

features.label: Functionality
items: custom responsive grid of images written in JS. Each row's height depends on an aspect ratios of the images on the same row
SVG placeholders for loading visualizations
custom lazy loading for grid images and gallery pictures
responsive carousel of images with two display modes
page pre-loader
